SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST23_US010501_EntrantRejoinWaitlistUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST23_US010501_EntrantRejoinWaitlistUITest
public class TEST23_US010501_EntrantRejoinWaitlistUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 01.05.01: As an entrant I want another chance to be chosen from the waiting list if a selected user declines an invitation to sign up. These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Entrants can see the "not chosen" status when they are UNINVITED
  • Entrants can see the rejoin waiting list button when not chosen
  • Entrants can click the rejoin button to rejoin the waiting list
  • UI updates correctly after rejoining (not chosen status hidden, waiting status shown)
  • Entrants get another chance to be selected after rejoining
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1
Note: Full end-to-end testing requires:
  • Firebase test data with an event where the user has UNINVITED status
  • Navigation to EventDetailFragment with valid eventId
  • User profile setup for successful rejoin
  • Scenario where another user declines, creating opportunity for re-selection
These tests focus on UI element visibility and basic interactions.

    • waitForView

      private void waitForView(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher, int maxAttempts)
      Waits for a view to be displayed with retries. This helps handle timing issues with fragment lifecycle and view attachment.

    • waitForView

      private void waitForView(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)
      Waits for a view to be displayed with default retries (10 attempts = 5 seconds).

    • inEventDetailFragment

      private org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> inEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)
      Creates a matcher for a view that exists within EventDetailFragment. This ensures we match views only in EventDetailFragment, not in list items. Views in EventDetailFragment are descendants of scroll_content. First ensures scroll_content exists, then returns the matcher.

    • waitForViewInEventDetailFragment

      private void waitForViewInEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher, int maxAttempts)
      Waits for a view that's inside EventDetailFragment (descendant of scroll_content). This is safer than using inEventDetailFragment() directly with waitForView().

    • waitForViewInEventDetailFragment

      private void waitForViewInEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)

    • ensureOnEventDetailFragment

      private void ensureOnEventDetailFragment()
      Waits for EventDetailFragment to be loaded and verified. Uses scroll_content as the definitive check since it's unique to EventDetailFragment.

      Scrolls to a view to ensure it's visible on screen.

    • entrant_canSeeNotChosenStatus_whenUninvited

      public void entrant_canSeeNotChosenStatus_whenUninvited()
      Test Case 1: Entrant can see "not chosen" status when uninvited. As an entrant, when I view event details for an event where I was not chosen (UNINVITED status), I should see the "not chosen" status displayed.

    • entrant_rejoinButton_visibleWhenNotChosen

      public void entrant_rejoinButton_visibleWhenNotChosen()
      Test Case 2: Rejoin button is visible when entrant is not chosen. As an entrant, when I am not chosen (UNINVITED) for an event, I should see a rejoin waiting list button to get another chance.

    • entrant_rejoinButton_isClickable

      public void entrant_rejoinButton_isClickable()
      Test Case 3: Rejoin button is clickable when entrant is not chosen. As an entrant, the rejoin waiting list button should be clickable when I am not chosen (UNINVITED) for an event.

    • entrant_rejoinButton_hasCorrectText

      public void entrant_rejoinButton_hasCorrectText()
      Test Case 4: Rejoin button has correct text. As an entrant, the rejoin button should display "Rejoin Waiting List" text to clearly indicate its purpose.

    • entrant_notChosenMessage_displayed

      public void entrant_notChosenMessage_displayed()
      Test Case 5: Not chosen status message is displayed. As an entrant, when I am not chosen, I should see a message explaining that I can rejoin the waiting list for another chance.

    • entrant_canClickRejoinButton

      public void entrant_canClickRejoinButton()
      Test Case 6: Entrant can click rejoin button. As an entrant, I should be able to click the rejoin waiting list button to rejoin the waiting list and get another chance to be chosen.

    • entrant_uiUpdates_afterRejoining

      public void entrant_uiUpdates_afterRejoining()
      Test Case 7: UI updates after rejoining waiting list. As an entrant, after I rejoin the waiting list, the "not chosen" status should disappear and the waiting status should be displayed.

    • entrant_waitingStatus_displayedAfterRejoining

      public void entrant_waitingStatus_displayedAfterRejoining()
      Test Case 8: Waiting status is displayed after rejoining. As an entrant, after rejoining the waiting list, I should see a status indicator showing that I'm back on the waiting list.

    • entrant_notChosenStatus_hiddenAfterRejoining

      public void entrant_notChosenStatus_hiddenAfterRejoining()
      Test Case 9: Not chosen status is hidden after rejoining. As an entrant, after rejoining the waiting list, the "not chosen" status (with rejoin button) should be hidden.

    • entrant_rejoinButton_accessibleInScrollView

      public void entrant_rejoinButton_accessibleInScrollView()
      Test Case 10: Rejoin button is accessible in scrollable view. As an entrant, the rejoin waiting list button should be accessible even if the event details screen is scrollable.

    • entrant_completeRejoinFlow_works

      public void entrant_completeRejoinFlow_works()
      Test Case 11: Complete rejoin waiting list flow works end-to-end. As an entrant, the complete flow of viewing event details when not chosen and rejoining the waiting list should work correctly.

    • entrant_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterRejoining

      public void entrant_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterRejoining()
      Test Case 12: Event details remain visible after rejoining. As an entrant, after rejoining the waiting list, I should still be able to see all event details.

    • entrant_multipleRejoins_prevented

      public void entrant_multipleRejoins_prevented()
      Test Case 13: Multiple rejoins are prevented. As an entrant, if I try to rejoin the waiting list multiple times, the UI should prevent duplicate rejoins.

    • entrant_notChosenStatusLayout_containsExpectedElements

      public void entrant_notChosenStatusLayout_containsExpectedElements()
      Test Case 14: Not chosen status layout contains expected elements. As an entrant, when I am not chosen, the not chosen status layout should contain the status text, message, and rejoin button.

    • entrant_rejoinGivesAnotherChance

      public void entrant_rejoinGivesAnotherChance()
      Test Case 15: Rejoin gives another chance to be selected. As an entrant, after rejoining the waiting list, I should be back on the waiting list and have another chance to be chosen if spots become available (e.g., if someone declines).

      Note: This test verifies the UI state after rejoining. The actual selection process depends on the organizer pooling again, which is outside the scope of this UI test.
